contract extends the standard OpenZeppelin AccessControl model by adding the ability to enumerate members of a role. It defines several system-wide roles and is designed to be a central authority for permissions across the entire protocol. e.sol":{"keccak256":"0x89be10e757d242e9b18d5a32c9fbe2019f6d63052bbe46397a430a1d60d7f794","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f103ee2e4aecd37aac6ceefe670709cdd7613dee25fa2d4d9feaf7fc0aaa155e","dweb:/ipfs/QmRiNZLoJk5k3HPMYGPGjZFd2ke1ZxjhJZkM45Ec9GH9hv"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts-upgradeable/contracts/utils/AddressUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9c80f545915582e63fe206c6ce27cbe85a86fc10b9cd2a0e8c9488fb7c2ee422","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://310136ad60820af4177a11a61d77a3686faf5fca4942b600e08fc940db38396b","dweb:/ipfs/QmbCzMNSTL7Zi7M4UCSqBrkHtp4jjxUnGbkneCZKdR1qeq"]}},"version":1}

constructor.details: Disables the regular constructor to make the contract upgradeable.

params.role: The `bytes32` identifier of the role to query.

returns._0: The `bytes32` identifier of the admin role.

params.index: The index of the member in the role's member list.

returns._0: The number of members in the role.

params.limit: The maximum number of members to return.

returns.page: A memory array of member addresses.
returns.totalMembers: The total number of members in the role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: The caller must have the admin role for the specified `role`.

params.account: The address to grant the role to.
params.role: The `bytes32` identifier of the role to grant.

returns._0: A boolean indicating whether the account has the role.

initialize(address).details: Sets up the role hierarchy and grants the `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` to the provided admin address. This function can only be called once.

params.admin: The address of the initial default admin.

params.role: The `bytes32` identifier of the role to renounce.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: The caller must have the admin role for the specified `role`.

params.account: The address to revoke the role from.
params.role: The `bytes32` identifier of the role to revoke.

setRoleAdmin(bytes32,bytes32).details: The caller must have the current admin role for the target role.

DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE().notice: The default admin role, which can manage other roles.

EMERGENCY_ROLE().notice: The role for managing emergency states and actions.

MINTER_ROLE().notice: The role for minting new tokens.

PARAMETER_ROLE().notice: The role for managing critical system parameters.

PAUSER_ROLE().notice: The role for pausing and unpausing system components.

PROXY_ADMIN_ROLE().notice: The role for managing the ProxyAdmin contract itself.

UPGRADER_ROLE().notice: The role for managing contract upgrades via the ProxyAdmin.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).notice: Returns the admin role that controls a given `role`.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).notice: Returns the address of a member of a role by their index.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).notice: Returns the number of accounts that have been granted a `role`.

getRoleMembersPaginated(bytes32,uint256,.notice: Returns a paginated list of members for a given role.

hasRole(bytes32,address).notice: Checks if an `account` has been granted a `role`.

renounceRole(bytes32).notice: Allows the caller to renounce a `role` they hold.

setRoleAdmin(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Sets the admin role for a given role.
